content: Act as a helpful AI assistant
In Julia, Given a DataFrame df_cars with column `model`, write a function `count_model_rows` that groups data by model and calculate how many rows there are for each.

Here is an example of such a function in Julia:

```julia
using DataFrames, CategoricalArrays

function count_model_rows(df::DataFrame)
    grouped = groupby(df, :model)
    counts = map(x -> size(x)[1], grouped)
    return counts
end
```

This function takes a DataFrame as input and uses the `groupby` function from the DataFrames.jl package to group the data by the column "model". The `map` function then applies a function (which in this case is `size` which returns the size of an array) to each group, returning an array of counts for each model.

You can use it like so:

```julia
df_cars = DataFrame(model=["BMW", "Mercedes", "Ford", "BMW", "Mercedes"],
                   price=[52400, 59900, 29900, 52400, 59900],
                   year=[1997, 2001, 1993, 1997, 2001])
count_model_rows(df_cars)
```

This will return an array with the counts of rows for each model.
